Hello, I'm not certain if he was the best Samurai since there are several o=
thers who were accomplished swordsmen but used very different styles of swo=
rdplay. The Furanui style of Kenjutsu he was supposed to have been a master=
 of would have given him some claim to fame but his opposition to the Tokug=
awa Shogunate and the way he was murdered on manufactured charges certainly=
 gave him the status of an honored martyr.

Roberto Cedillo <nei_ye@yahoo.c=
om> wrote:
